intro: Apium procumbens, commonly known as匍匐茴香, is a low-growing annual herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It has slender, branching stems that lie close to the ground, often forming a dense mat. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, with a mild anise-like scent. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
